page.title: 14LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: {An interview with an old resident:-} Mrs.Clapperton, was 9 years old when she moved to Rainworth.She went to school at Heathlands,then she went to Wesleyan school,& then to Python Hill. There was a big church,& there were no new estates.The pit manager's children used to come to school in a horse & trap.There used to be 6 old shops. There was the model village & white city,Joseph Whitaker & Lake View schools were not even built.They had a boys brigade & a girls brigade.There was a doctor,he was german,& 2 midwives.Blidworth & Rainworth Station was where Station Road is now.There was only 1 farm which was called Cantrells Farm Davis & Hope buses were the first ever to run through Rainworth.They didn't have trams as i had expected.There were no flats on Rainworth water as there are now.
